intro: Stenogyne cordata, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Stenogyne cordata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas.
